intro: Ptilostemon gnaphaloides, commonly known as the silver leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-white foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in rock gardens due to its low maintenance and ornamental value. Ptilostemon gnaphaloides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
